alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 3:58PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...PERIODS OF MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS ALONG THE SEWARD HIGHWAY CORRIDOR THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... Bands of moderate to heavy snow showers will develop over the eastern Kenai Peninsula this afternoon and continue into Friday before slowly tapering off Friday evening. The heaviest of the shower activity will likely be late this afternoon through early Friday morning. During this time, snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are possible in heavier snow showers. Expect significantly reduced visibility in heavier snow showers. Motorists travelling the Seward Highway south of Portage are urged to slow down and use caution when encountering these heavier snow showers. Snow accumulations of 6 inches or more are possible through Turnagain Pass and from Moose Pass to Bear Creek. Lesser snow amounts are expected for Seward and around Portage and Whittier as temperatures remaining in the mid 30s will allow rain to mix in at times.
